description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows Kerberos security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-20674), apply the following security updates:

1. Download and install the appropriate KB articles for your system from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5034122](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034122)
   - For Windows Server 2022: [KB5034130](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034130)
   - For other versions, review the build numbers and download the respective updates from the links below.

2. Restart your system after installation to ensure that the security patches are applied effectively.

**Additional Details**:
- This update addresses a critical vulnerability that allows an attacker to impersonate the Kerberos authentication server, leading to possible serious consequences including loss of confidentiality and integrity.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running a vulnerable version applicable to the listed build numbers.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.

**Update Packages**:
- [KB5034134](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034134)
- [KB5034184](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034184)
- [KB5034121](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034121)
- [KB5034171](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034171)

Apply these updates to ensure the integrity of your network and users.
